channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: I tested the Leica Q3 Monochrom – it's a top digital camera for black-and-white photography purists
item.description: Leica's third premium compact Q3 model – the new Q3 Monochrom – follows the original Q3 and the Q3 43, ditching the sensor's color array filter in favor of optimized black and white-only images.

item.title: A ‘Baldur’s Gate 3’ Writer Explains Wyll’s Disappointing Arc
item.description: If you're still sore about Wyll, Larian hears you and absolutely agrees.

item.title: Indonesia blocks Grok over non-consensual, sexualized deepfakes
item.description: Indonesian officials said Saturday that they are temporarily blocking access to xAI’s chatbot Grok.

item.title: Google Photos might soon give you more control over how your photos and videos are backed up
item.description: It looks as though a scheduling feature could be introduced to Google Photos in the near future.

item.title: I tested the Geekom A7 Max - a mini PC built around a punchy platform, but the installed memory is an issue
item.description: The Geekom A7 Max is a high-quality NUC that needs some extra expenditure on memory to truly shine.

item.title: An Instagram data breach reportedly exposed the personal info of 17.5 million users
item.description: If you received a bunch of password reset requests from Instagram recently, you're not alone. As reported by Malwarebytes, an antivirus software company, there was a data breach revealing the "sensitive information" of 17.5 million Instagram users. Malwarebytes added that the leak included Instagram usernames, physical addresses, phone numbers, email addresses and more. The company added that the "data is available for sale on the dark web and can be abused by cybercriminals." Malwarebytes noted in an email to its customers that it discovered the breach during its routine dark web scan and tha...

item.title: Exclusive: Lexar debuts mysterious AI grade stick form factor that promises hot swap, blazing speeds — and no, I've got absolutely no clue how much it costs and whether device vendors will actually use it
item.description: Lexar debuts a hot-swappable AI-Grade Storage Stick at CES 2026, promising blazing speeds, flexibility, and uncertain adoption by manufacturers.

item.title: Bill Gates Warns of a Dark Trend In Depressing Annual Letter So Here’s a Little Deer Guy Absolutely Owning a Rhinoceros
item.description: Gates wrote, "these days, my optimism comes with footnotes." So how about watching a cute video instead?

item.title: Verge électriques, batterie solaire qui alimente une maison et batterie solide révolutionnaire – Récap’ Survoltés
item.description: Cette semaine sur Survoltés, les annonces électriques ont été nombreuses, notamment grâce au CES 2026. Batterie solaire, motos électriques Verges, marque de vélo sous pression ou encore batterie solide avec une durée de vie gargantuesque : il y a de quoi de faire.

item.title: GMKTec EVO-T2 has more AI firepower than Ryzen AI Max+ 395 mini PC — Core Ultra X9 388H delivers 180TOPS, 50% more than its AMD rival
item.description: GMKtec's new EVO-T2 mini PC is powered by Intel’s 18A Core Ultra X9, with support for up to 128GB of LPDDR5x memory and 16TB of SSD storage.

item.title: The Fourth Most Populous Country in the World Just Reportedly Blocked Grok
item.description: Indonesia’s restriction on Grok is temporary, and X has been invited to discuss the matter.

item.title: Pour les Soldes 2026 NordVPN fait jusqu’à -70% sur ses abonnements et offre 1 mois supplémentaire pour protéger vos données
item.description: Le célèbre réseau privé virtuel NordVPN fait ses meilleures promotions pendant les Soldes où l'abonnement basique, par exemple, est à seulement 3,25 euros/mois avec un mois offert.
